svcproc.title: Sensor Identification

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure the transmission is in neutral, parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before doing diagnostic or service procedures on engine or vehicle.

svcproc.para: This section should be used for sensor identification and location. For a more detailed description of the electrical sensors, see the Engine and Vehicle Sensors in the "Introduction" in this manual, or the corresponding diagnostic manual.

The CMP sensor is a magnetic type sensor. It responds to a rotating actuator positioned on the camshaft gear. The CMP sensor is installed in the front cover, above and to the right of the water pump pulley.

When ordering this sensor for replacement, make sure that the sensor you receive is the same one pictured. This sensor is used in different International Truck and Engine Corporation applications to sense crankshaft position.
The CKP sensor is a magnetic pickup sensor. The CKP sensor is installed on the top left of the flywheel housing.

When ordering this sensor for replacement, make sure that the sensor you receive is the same one pictured. This sensor is used in different International Truck and Engine Corporation applications to sense camshaft position.

figure.caption: Engine Oil Temperature (EOT) sensor and Engine Coolant Temperature (ECT) sensor

svcproc.para: The EOT sensor is a thermistor type sensor. The EOT sensor is installed in the rear of the front cover, left of the high-pressure oil pump assembly.
The ECT sensor is a thermistor type sensor. The ECT sensor is installed in the water supply housing (Freon® compressor bracket), left of the flat idler pulley assembly.
The MAT sensor is a thermistor type sensor. The MAT sensor is installed to the right of the MAP sensor in the intake manifold.
The EOP sensor is a variable capacitance sensor. The EOP sensor is installed on the left of the crankcase below and left of the fuel filter housing.
The ICP sensor is a variable capacitance sensor. The ICP sensor is installed left of the engine Brake shutoff valve in the high-pressure rail.
The BCP sensor is a variable capacitance sensor. The BCP sensor is installed forward of the engine Brake shutoff valve in the high-pressure rail.
The EFP sensor is a variable capacitance sensor. The EFP sensor is installed in the rear of the fuel filter assembly (crankcase side).
The MAP sensor is a variable capacitance sensor. The MAP sensor is installed left of the MAT sensor in the intake manifold.
The EBP sensor is a variable capacitance sensor. The EBP sensor is installed in a bracket mounted on the water supply housing (Freon® compressor bracket).
The Water In Fuel sensor detects water in the fuel. The WIF sensor is installed at the base of the fuel filter housing.
The IPR valve is a pulse width modulated valve that regulates the injection control pressure. The valve is located on the rear of the high-pressure oil pump.
